column2: PA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column10: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 2. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 3. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column6: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column8: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 4. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 5. Which of the following is true about the speed at which you travel?
column6: The speed limit is always a safe speed.
column8: The safe speed to drive depends on many conditions.

column2: 6. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column8: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 7. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 8. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 9. This road sign is:
10. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 11. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 13. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
14. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 15. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 16. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. Which shape is a yield sign?
18. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
